intro: Luzula echinata var. mesochorea, commonly known as the spiked wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like foliage and produces small, clustered spikes of greenish or brownish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
